#summary Configuration Options

Each package in aic-expresso has its own default [http://code.google.com/p/aic-util/wiki/Configuration configuration] settings, which can be overridden at run time.

= Grinder =
The [http://code.google.com/p/aic-expresso/source/browse/trunk/src/main/java/com/sri/ai/grinder/GrinderConfiguration.java Grinder Configuration] options are as follows:

Note: The following options must be set before any [http://code.google.com/p/aic-expresso/source/browse/trunk/src/main/java/com/sri/ai/grinder/helper/Trace.java Trace]  or [http://code.google.com/p/aic-expresso/source/browse/trunk/src/main/java/com/sri/ai/grinder/helper/Justification.java Justification] calls are made in the code as they apply to the underlying [http://logback.qos.ch/ logging] system.

||Name||Default||Description||
|| trace.level                          || trace  || Enabled by default, set to 'off' to disable globally.  ||
|| justification.level                  || trace  || Enabled by default, set to 'off' to disable globally. ||
|| grinder.display.tree.util.ui         || true   || Relevant appenders are configured in the logback-test.xml to output trace and justification information to a GUI during testing.  || 
|| grinder.wait.until.ui.closed.enabled || false  || If the Tree Util UI is enabled, keep it open even when testing is complete. Useful to turn on if investigating a particular test case and you want to inspect the trace our justification output generated once the test has completed. ||

||Name||Default||Description||
|| grinder.cardinalilty.assume.domains.always.large || false || Used to determine if the [http://code.google.com/p/aic-expresso/wiki/RewriterCard cardinality] computation logic makes the assumption that the domain size of all logical variables is always greater than the number of constants present in the model.  ||
|| grinder.replace.variable.by.constant.it.is.bound.to || true || Used by the [http://code.google.com/p/aic-expresso/source/browse/trunk/src/main/java/com/sri/ai/grinder/library/equality/cardinality/direct/core/IncompleteLinearImpliedCertainty.java Incomplete Linear Implied Certainty] atomic rewriter (used in [http://code.google.com/p/aic-expresso/wiki/RewriterSimplify R_simplify]) to determine if it should replace logical variables the the value it is bound to in a particular execution context (e.g. `if X = ann then hello(X) else goodbye()`, would change `hello(X)` to `hello(ann)`)||
|| grinder.rewrite.dead.ends.cache.maximum.size || No Maximum ||  ||
|| grinder.rewrite.dead.ends.cache.garbage.collection.period || No Collection ||  ||
|| grinder.rewriting.process.cache.maximum.size || No Maximum ||  ||
|| grinder.rewriting.process.cache.garbage.collection.period || No Collection ||  ||
|| grinder.rewriting.filter.out.logging.by.rewriters.named || Empty String  ||  ||
|| grinder.demo.ui.default.look.and.feel || Nimbus ||  ||

= Brewer =
The [http://code.google.com/p/aic-expresso/source/browse/trunk/src/main/java/com/sri/ai/brewer/BrewerConfiguration.java Brewer Configuration] options are as follows:

||Name||Default||Description||
|| brewer.default.grammar.class || `CommonGrammar.class.getName()` || The name of the class for the Grammar to be used by the [http://code.google.com/p/aic-expresso/wiki/BrewerOverview Writer] when outputting String representations of Expression objects. ||

Note: The following options all refer to the original [http://code.google.com/p/aic-expresso/source/browse/trunk/src/main/java/com/sri/ai/brewer/api/BrewerParser.java Brewer Parser] implementation, which has been largely replaced by a faster [http://www.antlr.org/ ANTLR-generated parser]:
||Name||Default||Description||
|| brewer.use.parsing.cache                                                     || true  ||  ||
|| brewer.parser.flag.look.ahead                                                || false ||  ||
|| brewer.parser.flag.set.limit.based.on.parenthetical.tokens                   || true  ||  ||
|| brewer.parser.flag.prune.by.length.lower.bound.and.limit                     || true  ||  ||
|| brewer.parser.flag.log.is.on                                                 || false ||  ||
|| brewer.parser.flag.log.cache.usage.unless.logging.is.off                     || true  ||  ||
|| brewer.parser.flag.log.list.of.cache.items.unless.cache.usage.logging.is.off || false ||  ||
|| brewer.output.parsing.time.info                                              || true  ||  ||

= Expresso =
The [http://code.google.com/p/aic-expresso/source/browse/trunk/src/main/java/com/sri/ai/expresso/ExpressoConfiguration.java Expresso Configuration] options are as follows:

||Name||Default||Description||
||expresso.display.numeric.precision.for.symbols||9|| The dot relative precision to which numeric Symbols should be displayed (e.g. toString() representation). ||
||expresso.use.global.symbol.table||true|| Whether or not a global symbol table should be used. ||
||expresso.global.symbol.table.maximum.size||No Maximum Size|| The maximum size allowed for the global symbol table (defaults to no maximum, i.e. -1). Setting to 0 is the same as having no global symbol table. ||
||expresso.syntax.to.string.unary.function.class||`SyntaxTreeToStringFunction.class.getName()`|| The name of the Function to instantiate, which is used to convert Expression objects to a corresponding String representation. ||
||expresso.syntax.to.string.thread.cache.timeout||60|| The amount of time, in seconds, that a cache for maintaining instances of syntax to string functions on a per-thread basis is to maintain its entries. ||
